file_content.text: I will not forget.
You prove outsiders live with honor.
I am not your honores.
Go. I will meet you later.
I am not your honores.
I petition Mirev-Ka and the tribunal. For the outsider.
The outsider is accused of trafficking with Gormak. You take this on?
I do.
You both agree to all proceedings?
We do.
Don't I get a say in this?
Don't speak for me.
I'll play this one by the book.
I do.
I'm not agreeing to anything.
I don't!
To be heard, outsider, follow our procedures.
You are accused of trafficking with Gormak. Testimony?
The recording shows everything you need.
The trafficker is dead.
Jela Reneke sold the Gormak monstrosities.
It's all part of a Sith plan to weaken Voss for takeover by the Gormak.
[Lie] The Empire is behind it.
A grave accusation.
Lord Wratchen entered the Nightmare Lands to conspire with Gormak.
I was trying to uncover a sophisticated smuggling operation, headed by Rogun the Butcher.
I'll tell you everything.
The outsiders called "Exchange" worked with Jela Reneke to sell Gormak abominations.
We must confer....
The evidence speaks. This crime is Jela Reneke's. She has been punished.
But you have other transgressions.
It's always something.
Here we go again....
What do you think I've done?
What transgressions?
You can't just start making up new accusations!
That's not fair!
For negotiating with Gormak, entering forbidden territory and corrupting the moral health of an honores, you owe a debt.
The accusation was trafficking, not--
You speak out of turn, husband.
It was my idea, honorable adjudicators. These lesser crimes stopped Jela Reneke. Punish me.
You guys decide whatever you want. I'm leaving.
I'm done here.
Leave and you lose all diplomatic privileges on Voss.
I can't wait to see the last of this place.
I'm out of here.
We are through. I will take no more risks.
Your assignment is over, honores Lokir-Ka.
Do not seek the favor of the Voss again.
You are innocent. They have no right....
You sound more like an outsider with each word, Lokir-Ka.
I will work this out. Go. I will find you later, at our, ah, mutual friend's shop.
What kind of debt to society are we talking about?
Fine, I'll take my rap.
All right. All right. Lokir did it. I was just trying to save him.
Lokir's the guilty one.
You think I'm ashamed of what I did? What's your sentence?
I'll take my own rap.
You must serve Voss.
We will not prolong your stay. Aid our community by making deliveries to our settlers offworld.
Lokir-Ka will provide the details.
I will work this out. Meet me at our...mutual friend's shop.
He's the one who should be on trial here.
True. All Lokir's fault.
That is... implausible. But it is Lokir-Ka's choice.
Leave, outsider. This is a matter for Voss.
Jela's dead.
"The darkness must come, that the light shine brighter."
I will set a hearing with the adjudicators.
Better wear your best suit, Captain. And remember to make eye contact.
There's going to be a trial? I thought we did all this so there wouldn't be a trial!
Uh-oh.
What need do you have to defend yourself to these Voss?
Um, maybe I'd better sit this out. For some reason, judges and juries seem to find me untrustworthy....
You should not live with this stain.
Can't you just bring them the recording and get the whole thing glossed over?
I need a hearing?
Without judgment, you are guilty.
Maybe we could go over my case... say, over dinner?
[Flirt] Can't it wait?
On second thought, there definitely needs to be a trial. A really long one. Right now.
I will free you of this shame. It is all I can give.
I don't usually get to clear my name. Of course, I'm usually guilty....
Great!
What do I have to do?
Let's get it over with.
Go to the hearing board in Voss-Ka. I will speak on your behalf.
May your future path lead past this darkness.
I could not let you disappear into the Nightmare Lands.
I never envied tales of tragic love. But when I see you, I am filled with poetry.
Boy, did you get the wrong idea. I am not the poetry type.
We're just friends.
I... apologize. I am not familiar with alien mating habits.
What do the Voss say about love?
[Flirt] Tell me a poem.
"My tears fall to mingle with the rain/I envy its freedom/It may plant its kiss on any soil/And watch the living grass that grows."
Poetry?
That is from "Adasha-Ve," a woman who loves the wrong man. She dies fighting Gormak to redeem her name.
It is my wife's favorite.
Uh... you're married?
Wife?
Could I feel such things otherwise?
You... look unsettled. Is it true, aliens do not require the marriage ritual to perform mating behaviors?
I've performed my share of "mating behaviors," and you'll never see a ring on this finger.
No, no. You're right. She's absolutely off-limits as long as you're not married to her.
Haha.
This is not true for Voss?
Are you saying you can't...? Until you're married...? And only with your wife? Whoa.
Voss reach full maturity at marriage. Without a wife, I would feel nothing when I look at you....
We cannot do this.
I think there's a thing or two we outsiders could teach you about romance.
[Flirt] That's romantic?
If you return, instruct me.
Don't we have some kind of rule about not interfering in alien cultures? Well, we should!
I need to find Jela before she meets with this Sith.
Let's get back to work.
I doubt Jela's going to wait around while you finish your sonnet.
Let's stick to business.
I apologize.
I am still honores. I should see you off myself.
I could not send you to the Nightmare Lands with a call.
Take this holorecorder. It is my wife's--she is an adjudicator. Bring back evidence of Jela's crimes; it will be trusted.
That sounds ominous. What are you talking about?
Adjudicator?
Adjudicators judge crimes beyond the family. They will determine your guilt.
I'm glad she's willing to share.
[Flirt] Your wife's, huh?
She is virtuous.
I appreciate it.
Your duty is mine.
So, how do I get to the Nightmare Lands from here?
Where to now?
You have spoken with Talan-De.
Take this transport to the excavation site. Speak with Talan-De.
He is your best chance to survive.
So, back to the Nightmare Lands?
Where to now?
You were lucky to survive the Nightmare Lands once. I wish you the same.
To enter the Nightmare Lands, go to our commando checkpoint. The manhunt has not reached there.
Lokir. Have you heard of a place the Gormak call "the Nightmare Lands"?
The land's Dark Heart.
It is our shame--a cancer that comes from the Gormaks' touch.
Jela's selling the Sith Gormak-modified creatures from the Nightmare Lands.
I know Jela's plans.
Such crime makes trading in abominations small.
What are the odds there's a well-lit highway going there?
How do I get there?
The Gormak believe the corruption comes from the Voss.
They say it's your fault.
Gormak believe nothing. They hate.
Kind of a "he said, she said...."
Harsh.
This is not our fight.
I do not see such great difference between Voss and Gormak.
You're not exactly sounding all brotherly-love yourself....
The evil in the Nightmare Lands was born with the Gormak.
No man emerges from the Nightmare Lands sane.
Do you know how to get there or not?
Just tell me where they are.
If I didn't know better, I'd say you were worried for me.
[Flirt] It's sweet you care.
You know better.
My countrymen are dull in comparison to you.
Do not remember me as one who failed to warn you of your death.
I'm not planning to die until I learn what it's like to kiss a Voss.
[Flirt] I'll be fine.
You have long been immortal.
What else do I need to know to stay safe?
Then tell me more.
The longer I wait, the more time Jela has to seal her bargain.
I should go.
I'm not afraid.
This requires no hero, only a fool.
What kinds of monsters could Jela be working with?
What about the creatures?
Every beast on Voss has its dark reflection.
Go. If you fight our people, I cannot save you.
I will wait here.
You are my responsibility.
I will inform Scratch.
Are you Lokir-Ka?
Indeed.
May the Mystics see no shadows on you, Captain, and the duty to all weigh lightly.
I am your "honores." Your translation might be "chaperone."
All right, then. What do I do to avoid pain of fiery torture or whatever it is you do here?
Lay down the law.
Are you going to make sure I don't kiss any boys? Is hand-holding okay?
[Flirt] Ooh, a chaperone.
No.
Uh-oh. This is going to be a tough stop for you, Captain.
I like this place already.
Haha.
Jokes are a waste of time here.
Too bad. A little hand-holding might loosen them up.
I'm here on business.
Skip the greetings.
I'm here two minutes and already you people don't trust me?
I don't need a babysitter.
Your mission has touched a nerve.
The creatures that attacked your Senator Dodonna are a Gormak abomination.
Is that some kind of Vossian insult?
Gormak?
Any idea how an offworld gangster got his hands on those things?
So you recognize them?
No.
How would someone like me get my hands on one of these beasts?
Where can I find them?
You would not. On pain of death.
The Gormak are creatures of war. They create these monstrosities from beasts, set them against us.
To spread Gormak creations past the stars violates every law.
If someone's breaking the law, then point me to the criminals.
Who would know about this?
Voss do not commit crimes.
Theoretically, if I wanted to buy one of these abominations, how would I sneak it past the authorities?
How are these laws enforced?
This is not something Voss do.
Just tell me where I can find someone who knows how Rogun the Butcher got these things.
Stop talking in circles!
No Voss would know.
If you seek criminals, search your people. A settlement in the Minev-Ra caves. Called "the Exchange."
Where do I find these guys?
Jackpot.
I thought you didn't allow crime? That's one of the most brutal gangs in the galaxy!
The Exchange are gangsters!
Not our concern. They have done no wrong on Voss.
What was the name of those caves again?
I'll go talk to them.
Minev-Ra.
I have been there. I have an... academic interest in offworld music.
My trade was with a human named "Scratch." Perhaps he can answer your questions.
